description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to temper your fury. Instead of entering a rage you may instead enter a focused rage. You do not gain the standard rage benefits, instead you gain the following benefits
You may add your rage damage bonus to the first attack roll and damage you make on your turn.
You deal a critical hit on a 19 or 20.
You may take the disengage and dash actions as a bonus action.

description.p: At 6th level, your focused and disciplined nature allows you to shake off most brutal blows. Whenever you're hit by a critical hit you can use your reaction to reduce it to a normal hit. When you do this your next attack has advantage as your senses hone from the pain.

description.p: At 10th level, you have learned to control your rage but understand the merit of occasionally allowing its reckless nature to take hold. Now all attacks add your Rage Damage bonus to the attack roll.

description.p: At 14th level, Your ability to use your rage to ground yourself rather than give in has reaped additional benefits. When you enter a focused rage whenever you deal a critical hit you gain 2d12 hit points additionally uo score a critical hit on an 18-20.
